title: Subject Matter Expert (SME), Munitions Industrial Base
description:
CCI FSS, LLC is seeking a highly skilled Subject Matter Expert (SME), Munitions Industrial Base to join our team. The SME will provide expert guidance, support, and insights to the Munitions Industrial Base at Picatinny Arsenal to drive innovation, resolve complex technical issues, and support project objectives. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of engineering principles, industry standards, and emerging technologies relevant to their area of expertise.
  
This position will be located at Picatinny Arsenal, NJ.
  
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
  
The Essential Duties and Responsibilities are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed for this position and are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job. Other duties may be assigned.
  
* Provide expert technical advice and support on complex engineering problems, projects, and initiatives.
* Serve as the go-to person for technical questions and challenges within your area of specialization.
* Analyze and interpret technical data, design specifications, and engineering requirements.
* Review and validate engineering designs, models, and simulations to ensure accuracy and compliance with standards.
* Identify and mitigate technical risks and potential engineering issues.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, technologies, and advancements in your field.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of new technologies, tools, and methodologies.
* Conduct research and development to advance knowledge and solve technical challenges.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of technical processes, standards, and best practices.
* Prepare and present detailed technical reports, proposals, and presentations to stakeholders.
* Ensure accurate and thorough documentation of technical findings and decisions.
* Provide training and mentorship to junior engineers and team members on technical topics and best practices.


**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* 25+ years experience with expertise in both Load, Assemble, and Packaging (LAP) facilities and component suppliers (including Metal Parts/Fuze, and Energetic Materials.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex technical issues.
* US Citizenship required.
* Ability and willingness to pass background checks and gain access to customer facilities.
* Up to 5% travel within in the U.S. and Canada


**Necessary Physical Requirements:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Employees must always maintain a constant state of mental alertness. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
Essential and marginal functions may require maintaining physical condition necessary for bending, stooping, sitting, walking, or standing for prolonged periods of time; most of time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. Work is mostly performed from a sedentary posture. The employee is regularly required to hear, talk, sit, and use hands and fingers to operate a keyboard and phone. The employee may be occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and lift, handle, or move objects weighing up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust vision. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
About Bristol Bay Construction Holdings LLC
  
  

Bristol Bay Construction Holdings LLC (BBCH) is a holding company of Bristol Bay Native Corporation, an Alaska Native Corporation. The BBCH family of companies include 8(a), small, and large businesses operating under the Aerostar, CCI, CSI, Herman, and SES brands. The vision of BBCH is to be best value companies and employers of choice, recognized for our dedication to our unity of purpose, values, employees, clients, and shareholders. For three decades, our best-value companies have provided federal and commercial clients with superior quality and cost-effective, innovative, and sustainable solutions for general construction, restoration services, civil works, fuels systems, environmental services, professional services, and facility support services.
  
  

BBCH gives hiring, promotion, training, and retention preference to BBCH shareholders, shareholder descendants, and shareholder spouses who meet the minimum qualifications for the job.
  
  

We are an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender, or gender identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
  
  

We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program. We are a drug-free workplace.

title: Spin Instructor
description:
The instructors at Spiked Spin are dedicated to living a 'Spiked' life. They are highly enthusiastic, passionate, and determined to succeed. Their objective is to assist our members in reaching their full potential and motivate them to accomplish their physical and personal goals. The Spiked instructors are unique and genuine individuals who act as both motivational speakers and DJs on a bike. Their aim is to create a space of togetherness, empowerment, and courage.
### **Description**


**Spin Instructor Profile:**
The instructors at Spiked Wellness are dedicated to living a 'Spiked' life. They are highly enthusiastic, passionate, and determined to succeed. Their objective is to assist our members in reaching their full potential and motivate them to accomplish their physical and personal goals. The Spiked instructors are unique and genuine individuals who act as both motivational speakers and DJs on a bike. Their aim is to create a space of togetherness, empowerment, and courage**.** **Duties & Responsibilities:** **Pre and Post-Class Responsibilities:*** Arrive 15 minutes early to assist with room setup, warmly greet riders, and address any pre-class inquiries.
* Aid in the check-in process if required/requested.
* Stay an extra 15 minutes post-class to engage with riders, answer questions, and assist specialists as needed.
* Address any questions or concerns riders may have after the session.

 **Instructional Expertise:*** Cultivate a positive and comfortable atmosphere for participants.
* Begin and conclude classes promptly as scheduled.
* Deliver a well-rounded experience, including a thorough warm-up, engaging class content, and a motivating 'Spiked Closing.'
* Demonstrate proper form safely and effectively, offering guidance tailored to individual riders and considering safety and risk factors.
* Provide modifications catering to all experience levels.

 **Promotion and Community Engagement:*** Actively promote upcoming events, workshops, and Spiked Wellness activities.
* Contribute to maintaining and expanding the rider community.
* Demonstrate a strong commitment to assisting others in achieving their health and fitness goals.
* Serve as a Brand Ambassador, ensuring that the brand image is upheld and positively portrayed at all times.

 **Professionalism:*** Uphold the Spiked Wellness brand by wearing appropriate professional attire.
* Foster positive relationships with both Spiked Spin & Wellness members and staff.
* Adhere to professional standards, company policies, and safety guidelines outlined in the employee handbook.
* Address customer issues and complaints professionally, striving for positive resolutions and a superior customer experience.
* Exhibit punctuality, reliability, and trustworthiness.
* Handle confidential information with discretion.
* Lead by example, showcasing a sense of responsibility, accountability, and urgency**.**
* Work independently, making sound decisions to contribute to the company's overall objectives

**Qualifications and Experience:*** 1-3 years of preferred group teaching experience.
* CPR Certification is required within 30 days of hire.
* Schwinn Cycle Certification is preferred.
* Strong communication and verbal skills.
* Enjoy working with a diverse range of people.
* Maintain a professional appearance and behavior.
* High proficiency in social media.
* Availability to teach a minimum of 2 days per week and 1 day on weekends, including mornings and evenings.

 **Physical Requirements:*** High energy levels and the ability to complete class workouts without fatigue.
* Physical demands include the use of arms and legs, standing, balancing, bending, squatting, running, reaching, walking, and spinning.
* Capability to lift and carry equipment weighing 1-10 lbs.
* Competence in adjusting and operating fitness equipment.

 **Note: This job description is not exhaustive and may be subject to change at any time, with or without notice, to meet the company's evolving needs.** **About the Company:**  

Story: Spiked Wellness Co. is the first of its kind, intuitive wellness company disrupting traditional wellness experiences for Black women & allies. Building on the success of our highly coveted spin classes, we provide premium mental and physical wellness experiences, placing the needs of this community at the forefront and aiding in improving generational health.  

Expanding beyond the bike, we now offer pilates, yoga, wellness education courses, monthly mental wellness sessions with licensed therapists and psychologists, and nutrition resources and guides. This expanded wellness menu offers Black women and allies the ability to take hold of the health journey and prioritize progress over perfection.
Mission: Improve generational wellness, through you.  


#### **Salary**


$25 - $40 per hour

title: Front Desk Associates, Woodbury
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE**


We are passionate about **high performance living** and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a **disruptive approach** to unleash it. We **dream big** and don’t settle for the status quo. We **sweat the details**. We never accept less than **110%** to **help each other** deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, **what’s next**. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value **humility** and a **team approach** at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description** **We are looking for energetic, creative, and enthusiastic Front Desk Associates to join the Equinox team. This is a great position for candidates looking to make a significant impact in a growing and dynamic organization**

  

* Professionally greet members and guests
* Scan membership ID’s upon members entrance
* Answer phones professionally
* Respond to member questions, concerns and discrepancies
* Update members’ accounts if needed
* Maintain an orderly and clean work area
* Ability to work opening/closing/mid-day shifts
* Ability to tour members
* Provide the highest level of customer service to members, prospective members, and guests
* Aid other departments with other related tasks

  

**Qualifications**  

* Minimum of 1 year in customer service or related experience
* High school diploma/GED required or equivalent work experience
* Reliable, professional, computer literate, energetic, and friendly
* Preferably interested in health, fitness, and/or sports
* Must be friendly, vibrant, and outgoing
* Must be able to effectively communicate in person, via email, and via phone

 **ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Must be able to perform all essential physical aspects of the position which may include standing for long periods of time, sitting, constantly walking, squatting, stooping, reaching, and bending above and below shoulder height
* Must be able to perform pushing, pulling and lifting up to 50lbs at a time

 **Pay Transparency: $15.00 per hour**

 **Additional Information** **ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**

**AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop


This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com/***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: Electrical Estimator
description:
Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Electrical Estimator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate electrical estimates for residential high-rise building projects. This role requires a strong understanding of electrical systems, construction processes, and the ability to analyze blueprints and specifications. We are seeking a skilled Estimator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate and timely construction estimates for our projects. The Estimator will work closely with our construction team to ensure that estimates are thorough and meet the company's high standards. This is a dynamic and challenging role that requires a strong understanding of construction estimating, project management, and the ability to negotiate with clients.

**Responsibilities:**

**-**Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and new technologies related to electrical installations.

**-**Prepare and present detailed proposals, including cost breakdowns and schedules

-Develop accurate cost estimates for labor, materials, and equipment required for electrical installations

-Review and interpret electrical plans, specifications, and other documents to prepare detailed estimates for residential high-rise projects

- Prepare detailed and accurate construction estimates for various projects, including residential and commercial developments.  
- Conduct site visits to gather information and assess project requirements.  
- Utilize industry-standard software, such as HeavyBid and Bluebeam, to create estimates and manage project data.  
- Collaborate with project managers to ensure that estimates align with project goals and timelines.  
- Negotiate contracts with clients to ensure that the company's interests are protected.  
- Stay up-to-date with current construction codes, including the National Electrical Code (NEC).  
- Work on a construction site to gather information and ensure that estimates are accurate and complete.  
- Use construction estimating software to analyze project data and create detailed estimates.  
- Manage and maintain accurate records of project estimates and documentation.

**Qualifications:**

- Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Estimating, or a related field.  
- Proven experience in construction estimating, preferably with a focus on electrical projects.  
- Strong understanding of construction estimating principles and practices.  
- Excellent negotiation and communication skills.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced construction environment.  
- Experience with project management software, including Bluebeam.  
- Knowledge of relevant construction codes, including the National Electrical Code (NEC).  
- Proficiency with HeavyBid and other construction estimating software.  
- Ability to work on a construction site and in an office environment.  
- Strong analytical and organizational skills.  
- Experience with building and construction projects is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $72,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Experience:

* electrical estimating: 4 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11232 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11232: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Swim Instructor I
description:
**Salary: $20.00 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The Coney Island YMCA is seeking Swim Instructors who will be responsible for maintaining safe conditions at the branch and promoting a safe and positive atmosphere in accordance with YMCA of Greater New York Aquatics policies and procedures. The Swim Instructor will also provide swim instruction for different ages and ability levels and motivate their participants.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Must be Instructor Ready: uniform, lesson plans, maintain records (attendance, track progress, and complete end-of-session report).
* Instruct participants according to YMCA Aquatics program standards: using lesson guides, guided discovery teaching, effective class organization, and positive relationships with participants.
* Ensure instructional equipment remains in good condition. Have all equipment ready before classes and put them away afterward.
* Report repair needs to the supervisor whenever necessary.
* Set up, break down, and store equipment for each class.
* Attend mandatory in-service training on a monthly basis.
* Must attain YMCA Lifeguard certification within 90 days of hire and YMCA Swim Lesson Instructor certification within 120 days of hire.
* Know and understand the Emergency Action Plan and Emergency Evacuation Routes.
* Enforce Aquatics safety rules consistently and fairly.
* Maintain positive relationships with class participants, parents/guardians, non-class members, and staff.
* Promote other Aquatics programs and be knowledgeable about the pool schedule and programs.
* Maintain certification level of physical and mental readiness. Responsible for recertification before expiration.
* Actively participate in training sessions, designated meetings, and special events.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* Must be at least 17 years of age or older.
* Current YMCA Swim Lessons certification or equivalent.
* Current Basic Life Support, First Aid, and Emergency Oxygen certifications (if required by certification organization).
* Demonstrate swim strokes and BLS/BFA/EO skills.
* Excellent hospitality skills.
* Must be willing to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Ride Maintenance Supervisor
description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline, as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys R Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
  

For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**Key Objective(s):****The main purpose of the Ride Maintenance Supervisor is:**  

* To lead the Ride Maintenance Team Leads and Technicians in the maintenance of all Nickelodeon Universe and Dream Works Water Park rides and attractions.
* To ensure the highest level of workplace and guest safety.


**Primary Responsibilities:**  

* Ensure that all rides and facilities are ready for safe operation prior to opening to team members or guests using checklists, procedures, and best practices.
* Lead the training and activities of the Ride Maintenance Technicians.
* Lead the scheduling, planning, and organizing of staff, equipment and parts to complete routine and emergency repairs and maintenance, ensuring effective use of company resources to achieve maximum benefit.
* Plan and perform scheduled ride and equipment rehabilitations and ensure timely completion.
* Provide positive and effective leadership through communication, motivation, and evaluation, address any employee concerns.
* Assign tasks, utilizing the work order system, as needed to facilitate safe and timely operation of all areas.
* Review the quality of work performed by subordinate staff and provide feedback.
* Troubleshoot and maintain all rides and attractions within the scope of normal park operations.
* Ensure the overall safety of the immediate work area as well as surrounding areas.
* Always provide outstanding internal and external guest service.
* Conduct periodic employee performance reviews and appraisals.
* Complete departmental forms and reports.
* Process time and attendance reports and submit to the payroll department for processing.
* Support all company and departmental policies and procedures.
* Maintain Safety certifications through ASTM recognized national organizations (AIMS, NAARSO, etc.).
* Additional duties as assigned by leadership.


**Desired Qualifications:**  

* High School diploma or equivalent required.
* Minimum of a two-year technical degree in a mechanical/electrical field required.
* Minimum of five years working experience in a mechanical or electrical field.
* At least three years leadership experience.
* Working knowledge of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and comfort working at heights.
* Current Level 1 certification from a recognized nation safety organization (AIMS, NAARSO, etc.) or willingness to take certification examination/s.
* Practiced experience in mechanical, electrical, hydraulics, pneumatics and welding as applied to large machinery, amusements rides and facilities.
* Ability to work varied shifts to include, nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Practical knowledge of sound leadership principles.
* Working knowledge of Windows programs including but not limited to Excel and Word.
* Practical knowledge of Programable Logic Controllers (PLCs)
* Working knowledge of CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System) programs.
* Effective and professional verbal and written communication required.


American Dream is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment or discrimination. All employment decisions are to be made without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, pregnancy, national origin/ancestry, citizenship, physical/mental disability, military status or any other basis prohibited by law

title: Business Development Associate
description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline, as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys R Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
  

For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**Key Objective(s):**  

The Business Development Associate (BDA) will support the efforts of the Sales team by prospecting and qualifying new leads. We’re looking for an entrepreneurial team member who has an innate ability to identify prospective guests, contact them, and discover opportunities for visiting American Dream. As a BDA you will be responsible for 1) generating a pipeline of new leads via outreach and 2) Handing qualified and interested leads off to the appropriate Account Executive.
  
  

As a BDA hire, you’ll lead the development and execution of our strategy for all outbound efforts focused on generating sales via private events and group visits to all attractions/venues within American Dream. You’ll engage in conversations with event producers, leaders of local organizations, neighboring companies, families, and many others to identify opportunities for them to visit our property. Success will be measured by your ability to generate qualified opportunities that directly lead to new business revenue.
  
  

The Sales team at American Dream is fast-paced and highly entrepreneurial. The BDA candidate must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and constantly looking to improve while exceeding their goals. We’re looking for someone that is excited about the opportunity to play a key role in the early days of building our sales team and embraces autonomy in their day-to-day.
  
  

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
* Own outbound calls: Strategize and execute outreach campaigns to build a pipeline of new business opportunities across multiple verticals.
* Provide interested outbound leads to Account Executives.
* Enter and update data in the corresponding systems in real time (spreadsheet, email, sales tracking system).
* Conduct initial qualification calls with potential customers to identify opportunities with them.
* Iterate on the process: Develop unique approaches to outreach and come up with new campaign ideas that will lead to new opportunities.
* Meet with Sales team weekly to discuss sales opportunities and goal achievement.
* Assigned other responsibilities as needed.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  
* 1+ years of experience in a sales rep/business development role
* You’re a self-motivated salesperson that knows how to get your foot in the door with any company
* You’re comfortable leading initial new business meetings to qualify opportunities and present our value prop
* Ability to quickly learn the functionality and benefits of Salesforce and other sales platforms.
* You have experience and a passion for using technology wherever possible to maximize your efficiency
* You are a strong communicator and highly collaborative
* You’re comfortable in a fast-paced, quota-driven role


American Dream is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment or discrimination. All employment decisions are to be made without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, pregnancy, national origin/ancestry, citizenship, physical/mental disability, military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Retail Store Manager
company: Just A Little Higher-Upper West Side
description:
The General Manager is responsible for overseeing the Front of House (FOH) staff with a focus on leadership, collaboration, and effective communication. This full-time position requires flexibility in scheduling and task management to ensure the proper flow of the store.

Primary Responsibilities:

**1. Opening/Closing Procedures**

Opening Responsibilities:

* Ensure the retail facility is prepared for business by welcoming each person entering the dispensary with a warm, friendly greeting.
* Manage cash-related tasks, including opening registers, verifying starting cash amounts, and preparing change for transactions.
* Conduct thorough checks of delivery equipment and set up according to delivery checklists.

Closing Responsibilities:

* Secure the retail facility by locking doors, arming security systems, and ensuring all safes and cash registers are securely closed.
* Complete cash-related tasks such as cash reconciliation, preparing cash drops, and conducting cash audits.
* Follow closing procedures for delivery equipment, including closing out delivery drawers and uploading reports.

**2. Team Management**

Breaks and Lunches:

* Schedule and coordinate designated breaks and lunches for team members to ensure adequate coverage during operating hours.
* Provide support and coverage within different departments such as Sales, Intake, Fulfillment/Delivery Fulfillment, Delivery, and Ecommerce Associate as needed.
* Maintain documentation of team member performance, including conducting regular check-ins and addressing any performance concerns.

Facility Maintenance:

* Oversee cleanliness and orderliness of the entire retail facility, including monitoring cleanliness standards, organizing inventory, and restocking supplies.
* Communicate inventory restocking needs to management and ensure timely action is taken to replenish supplies.

**3. Customer Experience**

Service Accountability:

* Hold team members accountable for delivering excellent customer service by setting clear expectations and providing training as needed.
* Lead by example in providing exceptional customer service, addressing customer inquiries, and resolving issues promptly.

**4. Inventory Management (Assist as Needed)**

Inventory Tasks:

* Assist with minimal inventory movements on Dutchies software, such as verifying quantities of units available to assist with replenishment.
* Conduct regular product counts to ensure accurate inventory levels on the sales floor and promptly address any discrepancies.
* Process customer returns/exchanges efficiently and accurately, making corresponding inventory movements in the system.

Product Quality and Compliance:

* Report any product issues or concerns to the appropriate channels via Slack, providing detailed information including State Tracking ID and product description.
* Accept and intake product deliveries, accurately recording incoming shipments and ensuring all documentation is uploaded into the Dutchies invoice.

**5. Ecommerce/Delivery (Assist as Needed)**

Order Fulfillment:

* Monitor the ecommerce fulfillment dashboard to ensure orders progress smoothly from verification pending to Packed & Ready status.
* Assign orders to drivers and ensure timely delivery by coordinating with drivers and providing necessary support.

Driver Management:

* Oversee the dispatching of all delivery orders to drivers in a timely manner, utilizing Dutchies and Dispatch software to track orders and manage delivery driver flow.
* Maintain inventory of delivery driver equipment and reconcile delivery driver debit totals at the end of each shift.

**6. Product Knowledge**

* Develop comprehensive knowledge of dispensary's product offerings, including strains, products, delivery methods, potency, proper storage, serving size, and tolerance.
* Educate team members on dispensary's philosophy and ensure they have the necessary knowledge to assist customers effectively.
* Stay updated on industry trends and new product releases to provide accurate information to customers and enhance the overall customer experience.

Key Requirements:

* Proficiency in cash handling and excellent customer service skills, including issue resolution and de-escalation techniques.
* Understanding of rewards programs and willingness to adapt to changes and assist with tasking as needed.
* Full-time availability and demonstrated commitment to dispensary values and goals.

**Equal Opportunity Statement:**

title: Manager, Data Quality
description:
Weichert Workforce Mobility is hiring a Manager, Data Quality. The Manager of Data Quality is a member of the Global Business Solutions team responsible for overseeing the Data Quality Management and Quality Assurance programs. The position defines the Quality Management strategy and leads a team that executes QA plans to ensure data integrity within Relocation Management systems.

  



Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:


* Responsible for developing and implementing data quality standards and policies to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data.
* Supervises a team of data quality analysts responsible for ongoing data quality assessments and audits.
* Collaborates with the Technical Training team to design end user training plans related to data quality initiatives.
* Responsible for identifying opportunities for improvement related to data quality and process.
* Supports various company projects and initiatives to ensure that technology enhancements and process changes meet standards for data quality.
* Monitors data compliance and provides data quality reports to leadership as required.
* Analyzes and resolves issues within the data quality management process.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

#### **Requirements**


The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:


* Bachelor's Degree (Information Systems or Computer Science a plus) or prior related on-the-job experience
* Driver’s license required
* Five (5) or more years of QA and/or combined programming and QA experience
* Previous supervisory experience preferred
* Demonstrated training experience
* Relocation industry experience is a plus
* Strong ability to analyze data sets to identify trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement
* Ability to lead and motivate a team of data professionals in achieving data quality objectives
* Excellent problem-solving skills, a love for technical challenges, and a willingness to learn and innovate
* Ability to use data quality tools and software to monitor and improve data quality
* Understanding of data lifecycle management, data governance, and data stewardship practices
* Knowledge of methodologies and tools used for data quality assurance, including data profiling and cleansing techniques
* Ability to work independently and in team-based environment
* Excellent presentation skills; ability to present to a large and global audience, as well as to a small group and individuals
* Excellent facilitation skills – both live and virtual
* Strong oral and written communications skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products (Sharepoint, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
* Ability to manage and build strong relationships
* Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Good people management skills

title: Administrative Assistant - Older Adults
description:
**Salary: $24.00 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  


The Castle Hill YMCA Older Adults Community Hub is seeking an Administrative Assistant who will be responsible for administrative and general office functions, to support the quality and functionality of the Glebe Senior Center programs and services.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

Administrative:* Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of participants in the program by providing close supervision of all activities and ensuring spaces are clean and supplies are well maintained.
* Maintain up-to-date program flyers, marketing materials, program schedules, and website.
* Maintain internal case files, including, but not limited to, intake, assessments, attendance, interactions, case notes, and ensuring that supporting documentation is in all files.
* Support with data input in all data systems, including Stars, PeerPlace, Salesforce, etc., and use databases to prepare program reports for internal, City, and State use.
* Communicate with participants, including providing program information, scheduling appointments, and drafting letters and other correspondence, as necessary.
* Assist with the recruitment and support of volunteers.
* Assist with reporting to government and private funders, tracking and reporting student data and achievement results.

  

Additional Responsibilities:

* Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of participants in the program by providing close supervision of all activities and ensuring spaces are clean and supplies are well maintained.
* Provide administrative assistance to other departments as needed.
* Model the best practices of hospitality and positive culture.
* This position supports all aspects of programming, including, but not limited to, community outreach, recruitment, and participant outreach.
* Work enthusiastically as part of a team.
* Actively participate in all training sessions, designated meetings, and special events.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:*** High School Diploma/GED required. Bachelor’s degree in Education, Social Work, Mental Health, or a relevant field is preferred.
* Minimum of Two (2) years of experience in Administration.
* Current CPR/AED/First Aid Certifications.
* Bilingual preferred.
* Experience working with Older Adults.
* Ability and interest in working with diverse populations.
* Must be a self-starter, highly organized, patient, and able to work well with others.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office including Excel and working knowledge of Microsoft Suite.
* Knowledge of Windows-based computer applications and database management.
* Must be willing to work as part of a team and be able to establish positive relationships with participants, the community, collaborators, and partnerships.

  

**Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**
If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Kids Club Associates, Woodbury
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE:**


We are passionate about high performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, what’s next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company.

  

If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description** **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Professionally greet members, guests and children of members and guests.
* Respond to member questions, concerns and discrepancies
* Maintain an orderly and clean work area
* Regular and predictable attendance
* Ability to work opening/closing/mid-day shifts
* Providing a safe and comfortable environment for all children
* Ensuring an interactive environment between all children
* Provide the highest level of customer service to members, prospective members, and guests
* Aid other departments with other related tasks

  

**Qualifications**  

* Must possess proven experience in working with children of multiple age ranges in a group setting
* CPR certification or a willingness to obtain a CPR certification within 30 days of employment is required
* A warm and patient demeanor along with excellent communication and multi-tasking skills are essential

**ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Must be able to perform all essential physical aspects of the position which may include standing, sitting, running, walking, jumping, squatting, bending, and reaching. As well as pushing, pulling and lifting up to 50 lbs at a time

**Pay Transparency: $15/hr**

 **Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop

**All potential employees are required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination upon an offer of employment unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.**


This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com/***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: Middle School ELA Teacher
description:
**About Leaders In Our Neighborhood Charter School:**  
Leaders In Our Neighborhood Charter School’s mission is to develop the character of each student. We unite students, families, and staff in helping each individual achieve their best academically, and in sports, the arts, and service to the community. We believe that passion for learning, self-discovery, leadership, and social conscience are the foundation for success in college and fulfillment in life.

We believe that all children, regardless of their neighborhood, race, or income, are gifted with special talents to offer the world, and that school is a place for students to develop the skills and mindsets needed to become their best selves. Furthermore, we assert that human beings are more complex than annual data points, and that the fulfillment of a person’s life correlates not simply to test scores, but even more so to their relationships with others and the content of their character. With our family partnership and character approach model, we focus on helping students develop their character and the skills they need for life through rigorous academics, self-discovery, and family involvement.

**Teachers at LION Charter School:**

* Believe the purpose of education is both academic achievement AND character development
* Provide whatever is necessary to ensure ALL students are successful and are developing strong character
* Use data and assessments to inform and drive instruction
* Involve families in their students’ education and in the LION process
* Value feedback and evaluation on teaching practices and set SMART goals
* Support and challenge colleagues and hold each other to his or her best
* Voice their thoughts, opinions and suggestions and embody an entrepreneurial spirit, taking on leadership in a multitude of ways
* Pursue their own self-discovery and growth

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Ensure high academic standards are set for and met by all students
* Collaborate with other teachers to provide rigorous, standards-based learning to students
* Execute rigorous, whole-group instruction based on individual needs of students
* Use student performance data derived from teacher-created and standardized assessments to drive instructional decision-making
* Serve as case manager for at least 2 students receiving special education services participating in ongoing staff orientation and training.

**Qualifications:**

* A Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university
* A Master’s degree in Education or relevant content area (preferred)
* New York State Certification (1-6) or (5-9)
* Demonstrated success working in an urban school setting
* Strong data tracking and analysis skills
* An ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with colleagues, families and students
* A belief that everyone is gifted with a unique potential
* A commitment to character development and family partnerships

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Charter school

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Account Executive - US
description:
Are you ready to make some history?!

  

Foleon is a leading content creation platform providing business teams with a fast and scalable way to produce highly-engaging content experiences that bring a new level of intelligence to their customer journeys.

  


Foleon is based in Amsterdam and New York and serves more than 1,200 global B2B brands. We value people who are bold, ambitious, collaborative, and customer-centric. Even better, the ones who know how to work hard and have fun at the same time. We’re a team of highly driven people, with a great sense of human connection and a clear focus.  

  

If you’re looking to build your career in a fast-growing international tech scale-up, you’re in the right place.

 **Your Mission**  

An Account Executive at Foleon will spend their day speaking to prospective customers, diagnosing business challenges, and showcasing our product's value. Rather than hard sell, as a trusted advisor, your focus is on understanding our market inside out and using your passion and people skills to guide prospects in making informed decisions.


You'll manage a dynamic pipeline, handling various opportunities to drive revenue for the company and providing a solid ROI for our customers.

 **Your Job**


* Full cycle sales position progressing new business opportunities from inception to close.
* Regularly meet or exceed monthly/quarterly new business targets.
* Self-source 30% of your pipeline to maintain healthy coverage.
* Take a consultative approach when engaging and presenting to prospective customers, emphasizing business value over feature/function.
* Flex your business acumen by leading discovery, product demonstrations, and contract negotiations.
* Collaborate with the Business Development team to prioritize opportunities and apply appropriate resources.
* Execute our proven processes to maintain pipeline hygiene and forecasting in Hubspot.
* Keep Foleon honest by articulating customer needs, issues and trends to the product team.
* Represent Foleon at trade shows, industry events and other off-site engagements.

 **Your Competencies & Skills**


* Naturally curious with a genuine desire to uncover customer pains, business goals and connect them to the value and impact of the Foleon platform.
* True ownership over the results; always finding a way to ensure an appropriate level of pipeline coverage to achieve their targets.
* Perseverance: pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
* Willing to challenge ways of working and collaborate with the various teams that support revenue attainment.
* Forever Learner, obsessed with continuous learning and sharpening your skills; you look outside of the organization to peers and thought leaders to continue to strengthen your skills.

  

**Your Qualifications**

  

* You are a top performer in a sales role with 3+ years of experience closing new business in the technology sector or similar complex sales cycles.
* You have a track record of achieving or exceeding sales quota.
* Familiar with the marketing technology sector
* Demonstratable experience in a role requiring consultative selling. Comfortable with sales cycles ranging from 1-6 months.
* Proven experience sourcing your own sales opportunities
* Highly effective in both written and oral communication.

  

**What we can offer**



Training and development: In addition to biannual RKOs for formal training, we offer every salesperson access 1-to-1 coaching, self-guided study materials, and enablement material to maximize your potential.



Path to promotion: Foleon has a six-stage classification model for Account Executives. This role is level 3. Account Executives are eligible for promotion after exceeding their targets for four consecutive quarters.  



  

**Perks:**

  

* Work-from-Home Allowance
* Comprehensive Health & Dental Insurance
* Learning & Development Budget
* Paid Sick Leave
* 20 Days of Paid Holiday Leave
* Additional Holidays: Extra days off when Christmas or New Year's Day falls on a weekend.
* Work Remotely from Abroad: Flexibility to work 3+3 weeks from any location.
* Weekly Office Lunch
* Fitness Contributions: Access to Classpass or Bike City memberships.
* Mental Health Support: Online platform and counseling services for your wellbeing.
* Apple gear
company_description: Foleon’s leading Content Experience Platform (CEP) empowers business teams to create engaging and intelligent content experiences at scale.

title: Estimator / Project Manager
description:
PDM Group has a proud company history that dates back to 1935. One of our Founding Companies, Hearnen Air Conditioning was one of the first factory distributorships set up by Willes Carrier. We are a leading Industrial and Commercial Air Conditioning Heating and Ventilating Service provider. Our business was founded on responding quickly to our customer's needs, delivering good quality service and producing a positive result for our customers. We have an office with a fully staffed Service Department in Cranbury, NJ which provides HVAC Service and Maintenance to the Tri-State Area and beyond including Maryland which covers Metro Washington, DC and Northern Virginia.



PDM Group has made its name providing the highest quality Engineering, Design Installation and Service.



Our Engineering and Installation Department specializes in Design Build Applications from the simplest to the most complex including air conditioning, heating, piping and process systems guaranteed to meet your specifications.



PDM Group sells, installs and services all major brands of HVAC Equipment including Process and Comfort Chillers. We specialize in control systems including Building Automation, Process Chillers, and Cooling Towers for the Plastics Industry and specialty equipment such as Desiccant Dehumidifiers for the Food, Pharmaceutical and Process Industries, Humidification Systems and Data Center Cooling Equipment.



We set high standards for all our employees and sub-contractors. Their attitudes and skills are expected to reflect our company's commitment to exceed your expectations in everything we do.



**Now is the time to join the PDM Group!**


**Estimator / Project Manager**


**POSITION OVERVIEW:**



The main duty of a Project Manager (PM) is to estimate and manage HVACR and mechanical projects from conception to completion, while monitoring compliance with PDM Group quality and safety standards and all applicable regulations.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Responsible for quantity take-offs, cost estimating, cost analysis, bid reviews and document management primarily for commercial and industrial HVAC, mechanical systems
* Creating competitive and accurate estimates to achieve margin, sales goals, and financial targets
* Utilize centralized cost estimating models to ensure current and strategic pricing data is used during proposal development
* Follow-up with potential clients to finalize the work agreement
* Execute projects to the standard set by PDM Group
* Coordinate to obtain permits and licenses from appropriate authorities
* Schedule and manage resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations
* Develop, coordinate and track project schedules
* Acquire equipment and material and monitor stocks to timely handle inadequacies
* Supervise and interface with team members to ensure projects are delivered per estimates, as well as guiding technicians to provide necessary information to complete estimates when a site visit is not feasible
* Identify resources, assign workloads and manage schedules to ensure timely deliveries
* Address business inquiries from customer and team members in a professional manner
* Evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports
* Collaborate across functions to manage cost and price factors influencing customer acquisition, retention, and revenue
* Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues
* Process client invoicing promptly
* Generating leads and new customers
* Identify areas of improvements and concerns in his or her field team and accordingly develop action plans
* Ensure that team work in compliance with **company policies** and **procedures**


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**  

***Education/Experience:***



Degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field



OR



2 years' experience in project management and/or estimating in construction, mechanical, or related industry


***Preferred Qualifications***


* 3+ years' experience with HVAC and plumbing equipment estimates and projects
* Possess skill and understanding in conceptual estimating
* In-depth understanding of estimating & construction procedures and material and project management principles
* Communication and negotiation skills
* Attention to detail and organization
* Ability to read blueprints, structural drawings, and plan sets
* Advanced understanding of risk management policies and procedures
* Experience managing budgets and schedules for construction projects
* Ability to work as a team player
* Verbal & written communication skills
* Advanced knowledge of estimating software, strategies and techniques
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, & Outlook


**\\*\\*\\* REWARDING YOUR PERFORMANCE \\*\\*\\***

* Competitive Salary
* Paid time off
* Company 401K with match
* Life, health care, vision, & dental benefits
* Education and training provided
* Eligible for performance and company-based bonuses!


Website link: https://hvacnj.com

*PDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a strong commitment to the achievement of excellence and diversity among its workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Litigation Manager Assistant
company: Brandon J. Broderick, Attorney At Law
description:
### **About Brandon J. Broderick, Attorney At Law:**



Brandon J. Broderick is a prestigious and forward-thinking law firm committed to delivering exceptional legal services. With a blend of tradition and innovation, we are dedicated to staying at the forefront of legal practice and technology.



Come join a team, in a fast-paced environment, where the culture values Transparency, Accountability, Empowerment, Teamwork, Passion, Giving Back, Diversity, and Inclusion. At Brandon J Broderick, you will be provided with **training, mentorship, a career path** along with **perks** such as **Summer Fridays, competitive benefits, a robust holiday schedule, and work-life balance**! We care deeply about or employees and our clients. Our commitment to these values ensures a supportive and inclusive environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success.



Join us in making a difference and building a fulfilling career.


**Overview:**



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Assistant to our Litigation Manager to support our dynamic litigation team. This role involves a range of responsibilities from monitoring case-related documentation to managing interns and ensuring timely filings. The ideal candidate will be tech-savvy, an expert in time management, and adept at handling various administrative tasks to streamline litigation processes.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Monitor and Report:** Track and report overdue Form As, Form Cs, Motions to Dismiss, and Motions for Summary Judgment (MSJs). Ensure timely completion and submission of these documents.
* **Case Complaints:** Oversee the drafting of complaints for cases assigned to attorneys, ensuring they are prepared accurately and promptly.
* **Touchpoint Trackers:** Monitor and report on the progress of Touchpoint Trackers to ensure proper case management.
* **Intern Management:** Supervise and manage interns, providing guidance and support to enhance their effectiveness and learning.
* **Expense Management:** Handle all case expenses, ensure proper documentation, and update the expense report regularly.
* **Attorney Support:** Provide assistance to the attorney unit in the absence of support staff, ensuring smooth operational flow.
* **Trial de Novos:** Confirm that Trial de Novos are filed in a timely manner.
* **Timely Filings:** Ensure that all attorneys are filing their oppositions and briefs within the required deadlines.
* **Task Management:** Organize and prioritize tasks effectively to support the litigation process and meet deadlines.
* **Cost Confirmation:** Verify that all case costs are documented in files before mediation sessions.
* **File Follow-Up:** Follow up on all files lacking a date of accident to ensure complete documentation.
* **Insurance Limits:** Manage and address issues related to missing insurance limits.
* **Distribution of Case Costs:** Oversee the distribution of case cost checks accurately and efficiently.
* **Litify Reporting:** Utilize Litify for reporting purposes, demonstrating proficiency in the platform.
* **Tech Savvy:** Employ advanced technical skills to support litigation processes and manage relevant software and tools.
* **Time Management:** Exhibit expert time management skills to juggle multiple responsibilities and meet deadlines effectively.


**Qualifications:**


* Proven experience in a similar role within a litigation or legal environment.
* Proficiency with Litify and other legal software tools.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to manage interns and work effectively in a team setting.
* Advanced technical skills and familiarity with AMEX expense management.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy.


**Education and Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Legal Studies, or a related field preferred.
* Previous experience in a legal or litigation support role is highly desirable.

 **Benefits:**


* We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.


* Health Insurance

title: Paraprofessional/Behavior Technician/RBT- Afternoon Hours-Spanish Speaking
description:
Job Title: RBT/BT/Paraprofessional

\\*\\*Position Overview:\\*\\*

As an RBT, Behavior Technician, or Paraprofessional at CrystalCare ABA, you will play a crucial role in supporting and implementing personalized therapy plans under the supervision of Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs). You will work closely with BCBAs and other team members to provide high-quality support that enhances the skills and independence of our clients.

\\*\\*Key Responsibilities:\\*\\*

- Assist in implementing individualized ABA therapy plans as designed by BCBAs, focusing on skill development, behavior modification, and overall growth.

- Conduct one-on-one support sessions with clients in both home and clinical settings.

- Collect and record data on client progress and behavior to assist in ongoing assessment and plan adjustments.

- Collaborate with BCBAs to adjust therapy plans based on client progress and emerging needs.

- Provide consistent and supportive feedback to clients and their families to foster a positive and productive environment.

- Attend regular team meetings and participate in ongoing training to stay current with best practices in ABA therapy.

- Adhere to ethical guidelines and maintain professional standards in all aspects of therapy delivery.

\\*\\*Skills Required:\\*\\*

- \\*\\*Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) Techniques:\\*\\* Strong understanding and ability to implement ABA principles.

- \\*\\*Data Collection and Analysis:\\*\\* Ability to accurately collect, record, and analyze data on client behaviors and progress.

- \\*\\*Communication:\\*\\* Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with clients, families, and team members.

- \\*\\*Empathy and Patience:\\*\\* A compassionate approach when working with clients who have developmental disabilities.

- \\*\\*Adaptability:\\*\\* Ability to adjust interventions based on client progress and changing needs.

- \\*\\*Team Collaboration:\\*\\* Strong ability to work as part of a multidisciplinary team.

- \\*\\*Time Management:\\*\\* Efficiently manage time during sessions and while documenting client progress.

- \\*\\*Ethical Practice:\\*\\* Commitment to adhering to professional and ethical guidelines in all aspects of work.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Experience working with individuals with autism or other developmental disabilities.

- Strong understanding of ABA principles and techniques.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team.

- Patient, compassionate, and committed to helping clients achieve their goals.

- RBT certification or willingness to obtain certification within the first 90 days of employment (if applying as an RBT).

\\*\\*Salary:\\*\\*

- Hourly rate: $27 - $35, commensurate with experience and qualifications.

\\*\\*What We Offer:\\*\\*

- Competitive salary with opportunities for advancement.

- Comprehensive training and professional development.

- Supportive and collaborative team environment.

- Flexible scheduling options to promote work-life balance.

CrystalCare ABA is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Join us at CrystalCare ABA and be a part of a team that is making a difference every day!

title: Supervisor
description:
**Job Description**  

As a Supervisor, you directly support the store team with creating a welcoming environment that showcases the best of COS. You will play a crucial role in store operations, training and development, well as securing a safe place to work. Your partnership with the Store Manager is key to boosting profitability through high level customer service. Together, we're not just running a store, but crafting an engaging and profitable retail experience.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Offering customers a high level of service, through styling advice, product knowledge and store experience
* Opening and closing the store and supporting the other members of the management team when required
* Processing and banking daily sales
* Inputting payroll
* Taking ownership for the store audit result and training others on store operations
* Receiving and processing deliveries
* Replenishment
* Being a COS brand ambassador and providing the best experience for our customers

  

**Qualifications**  

To be successful in the role as Supervisor, we believe you are a team player with a proactive and helpful approach, fostering collaboration and collective success. Alignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviors that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are **open-minded** and **curious**, we dare to be **different**, we believe in **constant improvement,** and we **empower and trust** you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.


customers.

 **What you need to Succeed:**

  

* Customer focused and thinking in a commercial way
* Interested in trends and fashion
* Communicative, positive and open-minded
* Willing to learn, adaptable and action oriented
* Collaborative, inclusive and supportive
* Self-motivated, confident and resilient
* Excellent planning, organising and problem-solving abilities
* Able to work a flexible schedule including early mornings, weekends and evenings when required

 **Compensation:** $21.72-24.43

 **Additional Information**  

This is a **Full -time position offering 32-40 hours a week**.  

Apply by sending in your **CV in English** as soon as possibl. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.

 **Benefits:**


We offer all our employee's attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

  

In addition to this US based colleagues also receive:

* 25% Staff Discount
* Clothing Allowance
* Medical, Vision and Dental Coverage
* Employee Assistance Program
* Vacation, Wellness, Holiday, and Parental Pay
* Health, and Dependent Care FSA.
* Plus, additional Voluntary Benefits.

 **Inclusion & Diversity**

***COS****is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation.* *Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas**. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*

 **Company Description**  

COS offers a wardrobe of ready-to-wear and accessories for a life well dressed. Rooted in luxury design and compelling fashion movements, the collection plays meticulous attention to sustainable craftsmanship, quality and a superior colour palette that transcends time. The creative soul of the brand is visualised through original storytelling, seasonal runway shows and contemporary culture to create an experience beyond the expected. Learn more about COS here.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Paralegal
description:
**Job Listing: Paralegal**

**Company Overview:** Established in 1961, Einhorn, Barbarito, Frost & Botwinick, PC, is a comprehensive, full-service law firm devoted to serving a broad range of legal needs. With offices in Denville and Sparta, New Jersey, and New York City, our firm has earned a reputation for dedication to the legal profession and to the community. We are proud of the depth of our experience, creativity, and acumen in assisting clients through all of the stages of their lives and all of the phases of their businesses.

Our firm represents a diverse base of clients, from individuals and families, to public and private companies, entrepreneurs and institutions. We employ multi-disciplinary teams on behalf of clients to leverage experience in focused areas of concentration that include business/corporate and employment law, commercial litigation, accidents/personal injury and workers’ compensation, matrimonial and family matters, zoning and real estate issues, wills/trusts and estate planning, criminal defense, assisted living/senior residential legal issues, special education, estate/trust and probate litigation, and taxation. Our firm values professionalism, compassion, and dedication to achieving justice for our clients. We offer a collaborative work environment that fosters growth and development.

**Position:** Paralegal

**Location:** Denville, New Jersey

**Responsibilities:**

* Utilize case management software to organize client file, track progress, maintain deadlines, and communicate with clients via text software
* Drafting correspondence, assist in preparation of litigation-related documents, including, but not limited to pleadings, motions, subpoenas, affidavits, and discovery requests/responses.
* Monitor litigation deadlines and maintain litigation calendar (meetings, depositions, hearings, mediations, arbitrations, other important dates.)
* Manage and maintain case files, ensuring materials are organized, accessible, and up to date with regular client contact.
* Provide administrative support to the lawyer to enhance law office effectiveness.
* Communicate professionally and effectively with clients, law firms, medical offices, insurance adjusters, process servers, and court personnel.
* Prepare disbursement of settlement funds and request checks from accounting department
* Collaborate with attorneys, paralegals, and other staff members.
* Perform research using various resources to support case preparation and strategy.
* Prepare trial exhibits, trial notebooks, and other materials essential for courtroom presentations.
* Maintain strict confidentiality and adhere to ethical standards of the legal profession in all interactions and tasks.

**Qualifications:**

* 3+ years' experience as a paralegal
* Ability to manage workload of 60 to 100 files, juggle multiple activities, and work under pressure in a fast-paced office setting with a positive attitude
* Familiarity with NJ Court Rules, legal procedures and E-Courts
* Strong case management software experience, Casepeer, a plus
* Experience with 6 figure cases through the trial phase – including catastrophic cases, 7-figure cases, a plus
* Excellent secretarial and organization skills
* Fluent in MS office suite
* Bachelor's degree and/or paralegal certificate from an accredited program, a plus
* Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and interact well with clients
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance and retirement plan options.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** Our firm is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how your skills and experience align with our firm’s mission and values.

title: Estimating Assistant
description:
\\*\\*Job Overview\\*\\*

We are seeking a highly energetic and collaborative Estimator Assistant to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for facilitating the accurate price estimation of construction projects, ensuring that the company stays competitive and profitable. This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of office administration, schedule coordination, communications, construction project management, and the ability to work well under pressure.

\\*\\*Responsibilities\\*\\*

- Utilize Buildertrend and other software to distribute projects for estimates from subcontractors

-Document and incorporate subcontractor pricing into price estimates

-Schedule walkthroughs with property owners, subcontractors, and other stakeholders

-Write RFIs and coordinate communication with architects and engineers

- Review blueprints, plans, and specifications to determine the materials and labor required for each project

- Work with estimators on preparation of detailed estimates for construction projects, including materials, labor, and equipment costs

- Collaborate with project managers to ensure that estimates are in line with project requirements

- Negotiate with contractors to ensure that the best possible price is obtained for the company

- Maintain accurate records of estimates and communicate with clients regarding project costs

- Stay up-to-date with industry developments and best practices to ensure that the company remains competitive

\\*\\*Requirements\\*\\*

- Strong computer and office administration skills are an absolute must

-A strong interest in construction and estimating

- Experience with estimating software such as Buildertrend, ProView, or Bluebeam

- Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines

- Excellent communication and negotiation skills

- Experience with project management and construction site management

- Strong attention to detail and ability to accurately estimate costs

- Ability to work collaboratively with project managers and contractors

- Strong understanding of construction contracts and pricing strategies

- Ability to analyze complex construction projects and develop effective cost control strategies

- Proven experience with cost control and pricing

This role is ideal for those who have a passion for construction and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. If you have the skills and experience to excel as an Estimator Assistant, we encourage you to apply.
