title: Front Desk Specialist
description:
Description:

We are the largest multi-specialty urology focused practice in the country. Our doctors and staff are committed to providing the highest level of quality medical services available. Join our team for a rewarding career with a growing health care organization who values our staff as much as we do our patients.

  

1. Welcomes and greets all patients and visitors, in person or over the phone  

2. Answers the phone while maintaining a polite, consistent phone manner using the following proper telephone etiquette:  

3. Registers new patient and updates existing patient demographics by collecting detailed patient information including personal and financial information (ex. co-payments and insurance cards)  

4. Collecting patient past due balances  

5. Scanning incoming faxes  

6. Generate batch transmittal reports for each day  

7. Facilitates the patient flow by notifying the provider or other medical staff of the patients’ arrival, being aware of delays, and communicating with patients and clinical staff  

8. Responds to inquiries by patients, prospective patients, and visitors in a courteous manner  

9. Keeps medical office supplies adequately stocked by anticipating inventory needs, placing orders, and monitoring office equipment  

10. Protects patient confidentiality, making sure protected health information (PHI) is secured by not leaving PHI in plain sight and logging off the computer before leaving it unattended.  

11. Ensures proper hand-off of responsibilities once their task is completed  

12. Ensuring that all medical records are accurate and complete within the SBU for all patients  

13. Ensuring compliance of healthcare regulations, medical laws and high ethical standards  

14. Performs other position related duties as assigned

 **Benefits**  

* Comprehensive medical
* Dental
* Vision
* 401K
* Paid time off
  

Requirements:
**Experience Requirement** Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in a physician office setting preferably within the urology specialty. Fluent in Spanish.

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities** · To perform this job successfully, an individual should have the knowledge of: Internet Software; Word Processing Software (Microsoft Word); Electronic Mail Software (Microsoft Outlook); Electronic Health Records (EMR Software); Practice Management Software. · Ability to answer multiple incoming telephone calls · Demonstrate excellent organizational skills, multi-tasked abilities and the ability to perform well in stressful situations. · Knowledge in healthcare systems operations such as EMR, Practice Management Solutions. · Ability to work independently and manage multiple deadlines · Customer service skills experience is a must with excellent oral and written communication skills · Knowledge of Medical Terminology · Typing speed at least of 55 wpm

**Educational Requirements** High School Diploma Some college work desired

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to connect with students.

Come and be a part of something special at Lincroft Music, where teaching is a joy, and everyone is family. We can't wait to welcome you to our team!

https://www.lincroftmusic.com/music-teacher-jobs-new-jersey

title: Program Success Coach - DSP Grant
description:
The Success Coach will manage the DSP Grant funding, the Direct Support Professional Career Development Program, to play an integral role in providing student support. This position is responsible for mentoring and supporting students throughout the program, ensuring they have the necessary resources and guidance to succeed. Additionally the Success Coach assists the Program Supervisor in promoting the program, recruiting students to participate, budget management, and securing internship and employment. This role is crucial in facilitating the academic and professional growth of DSPs in the human service professions.**POSITION SUMMARY**


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Provide holistic and proactive advising for students; guide students throughout their enrollment and registration; monitor students’ progress in program requirements; address students' inquiries and issues; assist students in exploring options; communicate proactively with students throughout all phases of the student experience to thrive and succeed.
* Identify and intervene to support academically at-risk or struggling students and refer students to appropriate college resources to support the successful completion of their goals.
* Monitor the academic performance and progress of students and support their persistence, completion, and success through outreach, intervention, and collaboration with relevant support services.
* Organize information sessions and orientations to recruit students and promote the program and events to acknowledge students’ achievements.
* Develop and offer necessary workshops to improve students’ skills to enhance retention and completion of the program.
* Document and record students' progress and performance to contribute to monthly grant reports; contribute to a departmental annual assessment report; and fully support grant outcomes.
* Support budget and payment process to ensure timely disbursement of students’ stipend, tuition reimbursement, and instructor salary payment in collaboration with related departments.
* Work with the Career Placement manager to support student internship and career placement. maintain documentation and update the available career resources.
* Maintain working knowledge of services offered by the college and the grant and assist students in fully utilizing all the resources available to them at the college.
* Perform other duties as required. Administrative and Other Duties.

**This is a Grant Funded position that ends on June 30th, 2025.**

**SPECIAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**

**Education:** Bachelor’s degree in social work, counseling, education, communications, or a related field.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Experience working with diverse student populations
* Demonstrated ability to mentor and support individuals through educational or career pathways
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with students, instructors, and industry professionals
* Organizational skills and attention to detail, particularly in maintaining student records and program documentation
* Knowledge of Direct Support Professional and experience with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a commitment to fostering an inclusive and supportive learning environment.
* Demonstrates computer literacy, including proficiency with MS Office, Google Workspace, Constant Contact, and Database technologies.

**Experience:**

* Minimum of 1 year of experience in an educational setting, preferably working with adult learners or people with special needs

**SALARY**

* This position requires work up to 25 hours per week.
* The salary is $20 - $25 per hour depending on experience.

***Bergen Community College is committed to excellence in diversity and equity and creating an inclusive learning and working environment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for all positions regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, age, national origin, marital and veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other legally protected status.***

title: Account Executive
description:
**Company Description**  

Saatchi NY is looking to hire an Account Executive, a critical role for very fluid and active piece of business. The Account Executive works closely with greater account team, agency teams, and clients to coordinate and input on strategic development, creative development, and tactical execution for clients’ marketing campaigns in North America. This Account Executive will be the ‘composers of the orchestra’ and are essential to make the process, and creative work, wonderful and effective! The team is composed of passionate, high-energy, collaborative members that partner closely alongside an equally collaborative and engaged brand team.

 **Job Description** **Skills**

* Superb written and verbal communication skills with the ability to make complex feedback, thoughts and next steps simple and actionable
* Strong executional ability - proficiency in managing multiple projects to tight deadlines
* Proactive, solution-oriented, forward thinking.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Enthusiastic collaborator who enjoys working with other people and has the drive to make things happen in partnership with others.
* Eager to learn and grow professionally and have a positive attitude

  

**Qualifications** **Responsibilities**

* Correspond daily with Brand Team to ensure needs and expectations are met – become the main day-to-day contact for many brand members
* Partner on new product initiatives and projects with internal teams; work closely with partner agencies to execute integrated communication programs.
* Spearheads all Digital, Social and/or Print creative development/activation from brief to release and be main Account liaison with Brand, Creatives, IP’s, Strategy and Print Producers.
* Forward think/anticipate future internal and client check in’s and meetings (i.e., creative briefings, set up check-ins with project manager, ensuring there is time to review presentation materials with the team).
* Work closely with AS to create production timelines, take into consideration partner timelines and overall support the business needs.
* Support all aspects of TV production process; Support team on shoots
* Mentor and manage AAE, manage AAE in ensuring tasks are completed
* Lead weekly status calls with partner Agencies and Brand team.

**Other requirements:**

* Approximately 2-3 years of advertising/marketing experience
* CPG experience a plus

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $46,500.00 - $68,500.00 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/21/2024.

title: Client Care Representative
description:
***Client Care Representative*** **Schedule:**
Wednesday - Sunday 10AM - 6:30PM, Off Mondays and Tuesdays **Who We Are:**
ACC is one of the nation’s largest open-admission animal shelters, whose mission is to End Animal Homelessness in NYC. We touch the lives of nearly 30,000 animals each year. ACC is more than an animal shelter; we are a resource to the community, always seeking ways to keep the human-animal bond intact. With a 90% placement rate, our progressive, life-saving initiatives contribute to the successful placement of our animals. We strive to find loving homes for homeless and abandoned cats, dogs, guinea pigs and rabbits, both by adopting animals directly to the public and by partnering with more than 200 dedicated animal placement organizations (our New Hope partners). We also help keep NYC communities safe and rescue animals in need, responding to emergencies that involve animals as well as keeping our doors open 24/7 for people and animals in need. **Summary:**
The Client Care Representative is the face of Animal Care Centers and is responsible for providing professional, world-class service to all internal and external clients in a way that reflects the values and mission of Animal Care Centers. The Client Care Representative is responsible for greeting clients, connecting them to other departments when necessary, and providing information about all Animal Care Centers services including animal admission, adoption, health and behavior. The Client Care Representative is expected to answer questions about fees, legal requirements, TNR, external resources, and other, sometimes sensitive, topics. With such varied and wide-ranging responsibilities, their overarching goal is to ensure that regardless of a client’s reason for visiting, previous experiences, or current attitudes, each client is provided comprehensive, collaborative access to resources and services, and leaves feeling positive and satisfied about their interaction with our organization. **Essential Job Functions:*** Provide thorough, professional, personalized and sincere communications via email, phone and in-person interactions.
* Register dogs for NYC dog licenses online and collect appropriate fees via cash or credit card, as well as collecting fees or animals returning to their owners.
* Provide appropriate customer service based on circumstances while providing empathy and compassionate support to clients experiencing challenges related to their pets

 **Salary and Benefits:**
This position will pay $16.51/hour. There is currently an additional $1/hour differential which will bring the salary to $17.51/hour  

Animal Care Centers value work/life balance and offers a generous paid-time-off (PTO) package that includes vacation time, birthdays off, personal days and sick pay. We also value physical and mental health by offering a great open access Cigna medical, dental and vision insurance at a low premium to our employees as well as 401K and Pension, Life Insurance. We also have on-the-job training for 2-4 weeks, periodic all staff training to include safety, DEI, cross training, and other growth opportunities.  

Because ACC is a nonprofit, employees may be eligible for loan forgiveness, cancellation, and/or consolidation under the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program (PSLF). Created under the College Cost Reduction and Access Act of 2007, PSLF allows borrowers who work full time for nonprofits and government agencies to have their outstanding debt forgiven tax-free on Federal Direct Loans, after making 120 qualifying monthly payments under a qualifying repayment plan. **Please see the attached Job Description and Benefits Flyer for more details.** **Qualifications:**
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, often high stress environment; treats animals and people with respect, considering all individuals as potential collaborators; is able to be discreet and confidential in a variety of situations; possesses attention to detail and performs tasks quickly and efficiently; is able to document conversations and interactions clearly, with detail and transparency; is an expert communicator; is a people person and a team player; available to modify schedule and work location as needed to meet the needs of the organization, including with little notice; possesses a love of animals and is able to interact with them in a calm, non-threatening manner; is able to lift up to 50lbs and work standing for 8 hours or more; bilingual/Spanish preferred. **Education and Work Experience:**
This is an entry level position. At least six months customer service experience is required as well as a positive, compassionate attitude and good computer skills.
company_description: Animal Care Centers of NYC is the only open-admissions animal shelter in New York City and takes in on average 30,000 animals every year.

title: Animal Care Specialist
description:
**Animal Care Specialist**

**Who We Are**


ACC is one of the nation’s largest open-admission animal shelters, whose mission is to End Animal Homelessness in NYC. We touch the lives of nearly 30,000 animals each year. ACC is more than an animal shelter; we are a resource to the community, always seeking ways to keep the human-animal bond intact. With a 90% placement rate, our progressive, life-saving initiatives contribute to the successful placement of our animals. We strive to find loving homes for homeless and abandoned cats, dogs, guinea pigs and rabbits, both by adopting animals directly to the public and by partnering with more than 200 dedicated animal placement organizations (our New Hope partners). We also help keep NYC communities safe and rescue animals in need, responding to emergencies that involve animals as well as keeping our doors open 24/7 for people and animals in need.

 **Summary:**


The Animal Care Specialist provides a high standard of animal care to ensure the welfare of animals at the ACC Care Centers. With a primary responsibility to provide and maintain a clean, healthy living environment for each animal, the Animal Care Specialist has extensive, close interactions with those animals, empowering them as a source of vital information on the health, behavior, and needs of each animal. By taking note of and responding to this information, as well as through communication with others, the Animal Care Specialist ensures that ACC’s animals are provided with an environment and experience that supports both their physical and mental/emotional health.

 **Essential Job Functions:**

* Maintain a high standard of animal care and welfare, which includes providing scheduled feedings, clean water at all times, proper bedding and enrichment toys.
* Properly clean and sanitize kennels, wards, cages, equipment and areas of shelter as assigned, according to ACC policy and procedure.
* Exercise and socialize with animals on a regular basis while abiding to ACC’s dog walking guidelines

 **Salary and Benefits:**


This position will pay $16.51/hour. There is currently a temporary additional $1/hour differential which will bring the salary to $17.51/hour.


ACC values work/life balance and offers a generous paid-time-off (PTO) package that includes vacation time, birthdays off, personal days and sick pay. We also value physical and mental health by offering a great open access Cigna medical, dental and vision insurance at a low premium to our employees as well as 401K and Pension, Life Insurance. We also have on-the-job training for 2-4 weeks, periodic all staff trainings to include safety, DEI, cross training, and other growth opportunities.


Because ACC is a nonprofit, employees may be eligible for loan forgiveness, cancellation, and/or consolidation under the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program (PSLF). Created under the College Cost Reduction and Access Act of 2007, PSLF allows borrowers who work full time for nonprofits and government agencies to have their outstanding debt forgiven tax-free on Federal Direct Loans, after making 120 qualifying monthly payments under a qualifying repayment plan.

 **Please see the attached Job Description and Benefits Flyer for more details.**

 **Qualifications:**


Ability to excel in a fast-paced, often high stress environment; treats animals and people with respect; has attention to detail and a strong work ethic to complete tasks correctly; is a confident communicator; is a people person and a team player, willing to pitch in to help others and ensure the needs of the animals are met; available to modify schedule as needed to meet the needs of the organization, this position also includes forced overtime including with little notice; possesses a love of animals and is able to interact with them in a calm, non-threatening manner; bilingual preferred; Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds and work standing for 8 hours or more.

 **Education and Work Experience:**


Must have a high school diploma or GED, This is an entry level position. While previous animal care experience is a plus.

title: Forklift Operator
description:
As a company, we promote a culture of honesty and integrity, and value the trust it allows us to build with customers and employees alike. Our focus on our people is what sets us apart and keeps our customers coming back to work with us!

If you are seeking to be a part of a family, this is the place for you!

Performance Team handles end-to-end warehousing and distribution logistics needs utilizing our strategic network of storage facilities. Our facilities are capable of receiving, storing, processing and dispatching cargo, so we can build flexibility and resilience into the supply chain process. Our integrated solutions allow us to be prepared for supply chain risks, so we can plan distribution to better achieve lead time and goals despite unexpected conditions. Our extensive experience, connections, and deep expertise across different sectors, industries, and transportation modes, means we can be counted on for process excellence that will save time and money.

**Key Responsibilities**

· Load and unload freight as directed by shift supervisor and/or Lead

· Assist with Material Handling able to handle cartons weighing up to 50 pounds

· Maintain an acceptable level of productivity

· Operates a Forklift to move and pick products for shipping/receiving activities throughout the warehouse

· Ensure complete product accuracy on each order/pallets while maintain safety operational standards.

· Maintain an acceptable level of productivity

· Receive daily work assignments from supervision and/or lead

· Verify shipping documents, shipping labels, and purchase orders

· Responsible for maintaining clean and safe work area

· Participation in ongoing training opportunities

**Who we are looking for**

· 1 year of Heavy Duty Forklift Clamp experience

· Ability to lift up to 50lbs

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

· Ability to focus on details, pertaining to shipping documents

· Basic math skills required

· Ability to work nights, holidays and weekends is required

This position is designated as a Safety Sensitive position

*\\*\\*\\*Please note inhouse forklift training and testing is required before operating our forklifts.* 

You must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

Performance Team is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing .

title: Index Methodology Research Lead
description:
The Index Methodology Research Lead is responsible for supporting existing indexes to maintain competitive positioning and help drive overall growth in assets of tracking products.* Provide methodology change research and recommendations. This includes:
	+ creating alternative processes and rules to modify indexes,
	+ updating or re-writing index models to accommodate proposed changes,
	+ backtesting,
	+ vetting different data inputs,
	+ making suggested changes to methodology verbiage, and
	+ supporting maintenance of technical specification documents.
* Prepare and present standard and customized methodology change research analysis, including comparative index and product performance analyses, index back-tests, and other reports to existing clients and internal teams.
* Analyze and interpret a wide range of financial and statistical data from a variety of vendor and internal databases.
* Work with other parts of the research team and sales on product retention through methodology change research.
* Be a point person on the index research team supporting existing clients on methodology change research.
* Develop design briefs for modifying existing indexes (including specifications, methodology documents and models) to present a clear, focused concept for strategic consideration.
* Have knowledge of the competitive landscape and the trends in the business.

* Commensurate experience (at least 7 years) and/or Degree qualified in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Finance or related subject area.
* Proficiency in R, SQL, Python, AWS, Databricks, and Microsoft Office.
* Strong writing and analytical skills with sharp attention to detail.
* Deep understanding of exchange-traded funds, financial products, and other investment products in both the passive and active space.
* Client relationship management experience and ability to manage expectations and timelines.
* Excellent presentation and speaking skills.
* Position to be located in New York City. Alternate locations are Rockville, MD, and Atlanta, GA.
* This position offers the opportunity for a hybrid work environment (2 days a week in office), providing flexibility and accessibility for qualified candidates.


Come as You Are
Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
What We Offer
We’re proud to offer a competitive rewards package that is meaningful, recognizes the unique needs of our employees and their families and incentivizes employees for their contribution to Nasdaq’s overall success.
The base pay range for this role is $126,400 - $210,600. In addition to base salary, Nasdaq provides a generous annual bonus/commission (short-term incentive), and equity (long-term incentive), comprehensive benefits, and opportunity for growth. Exact compensation may vary based on several job-related factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to: skill set, experience, education/training, business needs and market demands.
Nasdaq’s programs and rewards are intended to allow our employees to:* Secure Wealth: 401(k) program with 6% employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Program with 15% discount, Student loan repayment program up to $10k, Company paid life and disability plans, Generous paid time off

title: Nasdaq MarketSite Events – Event Specialist (On-site)
description:
Nasdaq is a financial technology company, rewriting the future of global economies and markets by unlocking capital and opportunities through their technology, innovation, and expertise. With industry-shaping insights, unrivaled intel, and cutting-edge financial technology at our fingertips, we don’t chase the opportunities of tomorrow — we create them.  

  

Located in modern offices in Times Square, we look to recruit individuals with the passion to thrive in a highly dynamic and entrepreneurial environment. We have a results-oriented culture that demands excellence, agility, and the desire to move quickly and precisely to seize opportunities.  

  

The Nasdaq Events Team role supports and collaborates with our business partners internally to manage and execute listed and newly listed company and client events and meetings at Nasdaq MarketSite. As part of our global growth, we are now seeking to recruit an Event Specialist to join this team who will be responsible to support Nasdaq’s value proposition by planning and successfully coordinating daily Opening and Closing bell ceremonies across a wide range of clients situated globally, as well as the coordination and execution of events in our event space located in the heart of Times Square.  

To be successful, you’ll need to be passionate about events, detail oriented, thrive in a demanding, fast-paced environment, be a team player, and be extremely proactive with our clients, always putting them first and doing everything possible to accommodate their needs.  

Key responsibilities in this role include:* Plan and execute both Issuer and Non-Issuer Related Events Related to Opens/Closes at the MarketSite
* Produce live broadcast and recorded programs including, but not limited to, daily Nasdaq Opening & Closing Bell Ceremonies, client interviews, and First Trade Celebrations.
* Plan and execute issuer and non-issuer events, as well as internal and external meetings. This includes, but not limited to analyst days, press conferences, receptions, cocktail parties, dinners, product launches, and street activities
* Work across the organization with Catering, AV, Broadcast, Facilities, Creative Teams to successfully plan, manage, and execute events
* Coordinate and lead tours and photo opp request groups
* Demonstrate superior customer service and hospitality to all clients
* Build upon existing positive relationships and continue to build new relationships with issuers and non-issuers whenever possible to increase revenue opportunities, returned visits, etc.
* Liaise with various vendors to identify unique opportunistic ways to market and generate awareness of the MarketSite and grow sales revenue
* Responsible for daily bookings of MarketSite Opening/Closing bell ceremonies that become available with short notice. Your role requires you to take a proactive stance in identifying timely and world-wide events that translate in booking Opening/Closing bell ceremonies and events with 24/48 hours of notice.
* Proactively taking on new, impactful initiatives and exhibit a curiosity for learning
* Educate Nasdaq as a whole on the various ways MarketSite can be utilized to increase exposure and revenue opportunities.
* Leverage creative ways in which clients may use their Opening/Closing bell or event to promote their brand.
* Raise visibility for Nasdaq, its client base and external parties by promoting all facets of MarketSite.


Qualifications:
This is an exciting position in a growing business that would suit someone who is a serious self-starter with exceptional communication skills.* Education Required: Bachelor’s degree, preferred in communications, marketing, or hospitality
* Experience Required: 2 – 4 years of event, client experience and/or broadcast production
* The candidate for this role must be client facing with excellent communication skills (both written and spoken), must be comfortable making effective presentations in demanding circumstances, and interfacing with C-level executives
* Demonstrate sound decision-making ability and workload management skills.
* The candidate in this role should have the ability to multi-task, develop marketing project timelines (from start to finish) with capability to see obstacles early and provide solutions.
* The candidate in this role will be required to act as a liaison with other departments, sales and marketing team members within the organization for necessary information sharing and event awareness
* Helpful Experience: Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Salesforce, Monday.com


This position is a full-time in-office role (5 days a week in office).

In addition to base salary, Nasdaq provides a generous annual bonus/commission (short-term incentive), and equity (long-term incentive), comprehensive benefits, and opportunity for growth. title: Registered Nurse or LPN - FLOAT Primary Care
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


Job Description**Will FLOAT to the following Primary Care locations:**
=======================================================

**Berkeley Heights, Clark, Springfield and Westfield**


As a Registered Nurse (RN) at Summit Health you are a full integral partner in a multidisciplinary care team providing individualized team-based care. Under the direction of the Primary Care Provider, Clinical Practice Manager and Office Supervisor, the RN works closely with the health care team to skillfully provide and facilitate the coordination of individualized total patient care. He/She through the application of the nursing process, accepts accountability for the nursing care of assigned patients. This position provides leadership and clinical expertise in the assessing, screening, planning, evaluating, educating and delivery of care in accordance with professional nursing standards and patient needs. The RN will be motivated, energetic, and an empathetic communicator who is passionate about delivering the highest quality of care. This opportunity offers an excellent salary, great benefits as well as the ability to be part of a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying the complexities of health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.

**Essential Job functions:**

* Assist the physician and staff with the daily coordination of patient care and physician access.
* Function as the liaison between patients, staff, and physicians.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Delivers direct patient care within the scope of licensure and in accordance with SMG policy.
* Collects lab specimens according to departmental guidelines. Accurately labels specimens.
* Perform Point of Care testing, EKG’s and phlebotomy as applicable
* Prioritizes patient care by implementing physician orders and nursing procedures.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Manage Nurse Visit schedule. Prepares pertinent information needed.
* Perform patient intake, check-in/check-out as needed
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns or issues to the Office Supervisor/Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Assures all patients are correctly identified prior to providing and/or documenting care.
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.



	+ Manages Clinical Nurse/Assigned inbox
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Administers injections according to appropriate protocol. Documents injections accurately in EHR. Administers VIS sheets.
* Perform patient outreach to satisfy quality measures (BP checks, vaccinations)
* Coordinates and facilitates daily huddles
* Appropriately demonstrates telephone triage protocols and document in EHR.
* Schedules appointments appropriately and accurately according to department guidelines.


	+ Identify and schedule annual visits as applicable
* Monitor daily hospital discharge list. Collaborate with Care Management for TCM appropriate visits.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Reviews and updates medication list in EHR. Demonstrates understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures. Accurately and completely documents known allergies in EHR.
* Initiates and follows through with prior authorization requests, DME orders, home health referrals
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Checks and maintains logs for emergency equipment according to policy.
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly.
* Actively participates in pilot programs

**General Job functions:**

* Assists in ordering and maintaining of all supplies as assigned.
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules.
* Other duties as required.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Pushing and pulling, taking frequency and weight into consideration.
* Physical strength to lift heavy objects, carts, or items, taking frequency and weight into consideration.
* Physical mobility, which includes movement from place to place on the job, taking distance and speed into account.
* Physical agility, which includes ability to maneuver body while in place.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers.
* Balance is maintained during climbing, bending and/or reaching
* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking).

**Environmental Risks:**

* Chemicals, Chemotherapy and Fumes
* Loud noises
* Vibration
* Extreme temperatures
* Confined spaces
* Allergens: dust, mold and/or pollen
* Magnetic fields
* Radiation
* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients/Visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin, or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens are possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* Associates degree required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.
* New Jersey State Nursing License and BLS certification required.
* 0 – 1 years experience. 2-4 years experience preferred.
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Ability to perform diverse work assignments with time limitations with a high degree of accuracy.
* Ability to use problem solving, critical thinking and priority setting skills.
* Experience with Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, Email/Voice Mail) preferred.
* Experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with patient care equipment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.

**Travel:**

* Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed.
**About Our Commitment**
========================

**Total Rewards at VillageMD**
------------------------------


Our team members are essential to our mission to reshape healthcare through the power of connection. VillageMD highly values the critical role that health and wellness play in the lives of our team members and their families. Participation in VillageMD’s benefit platform includes Medical, Dental, Life, Disability, Vision, FSA coverages and a 401k savings plan.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
------------------------------

**Safety Disclaimer**
---------------------


Our Company cares about the safety of our employees and applicants. Our Company does not use chat rooms for job searches or communications. Our Company will never request personal information via informal chat platforms or unsecure email. Our Company will never ask for money or an exchange of money, banking or other personal information prior to the in-person interview. Be aware of potential scams while job seeking. Interviews are conducted at select Our Company locations during regular business hours only. title: Medical Receptionist
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Patient Service Representative (PSR) is responsible for welcoming and providing exemplary customer service to all our incoming patients at CityMD. The person in this position is responsible for registering patients and coordinating with the rest of the team to provide a timely turnaround for the patient. This individual responds to patient questions and concerns with a sense of urgency and kindness, both on the telephone and in person and is responsible for all paperwork associated with patient registration.

 **Essential Functions/Responsibilities**

* Greeting and welcoming patients
* Organizing and coordinating patient in-take and other appointments
* Accurately enters/updates patient information in system
* Assisting patients with completion of paperwork when necessary
* Scanning, updating and filing medical records
* Answering phone calls, questions, etc. in a prompt and polite manner
* Processing medical insurance information, verifying patient eligibility and addressing any patient questions about insurance (liaise with Billing department as appropriate)
* Handling cash and co-payments accurately and responsibly
* Providing outstanding customer service to every patient
* Informing site manager or assistant site manager of waiting room wait times, patient inquiries, etc.

**Qualifications**

* A High School Degree or GED
* Happy, welcoming, and can-do attitude with patients and coworkers
* Experience working in any high-volume/high-intensity service industry (e.g., hospitality, restaurant, hospital, medical office or retail environment) preferred
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Detail-oriented and a team player
* Computer Proficiency and superior keyboarding skills (approximately 55 wpm)
* Flexible/adaptable nature to work in a continuously evolving environment
* Passion for helping others in a healthcare environment
* Ability to effectively interact with physicians, patients and other staff members
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

**Physical requirements**


Ability to sit and stand for periods of time. Heavy computer use required.


Pay Rate: $18.25/hr

Our team members are essential to our mission to reshape healthcare through the power of connection. title: Vice President, Group Creative Director
description:
**Company Description**  

Hi there! We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives. Join us at razorfish.com.

 **Job Description**  

Here's the brief: We’re looking for help with one of the biggest tech brands on the planet. Heck, it’s one of the biggest BRANDS on the planet. Your work may be seen 1 billion—that's “billion" with a “b”—people in over 100 countries. This can be a demanding account that requires a high level of dedication and skill. But you’ll have help from a team of incredibly kind and talented people working at the top of their game. So, if you’re looking for a career accelerating challenge with one of our most important accounts, keep reading.

  

**What you’ll do**

* **Lead:** Reporting to a Group Creative Director, you'll create visual stories; merchandising products and services across .com experiences.
* **Create**: You'll lead with craft, taking your team of Copywriters, Art directors, UX-ers and designers from idea to execution with imagination and care.
* **Interpret:** You'll transmute briefs, requirements and guidelines into clear and compelling journeys that drive conversion.
* **Guide:** You’ll manage large teams and projects, ensuring every asset created fits into the larger picture.
* **Advocate:** You’ll both communicate and advocate for your work, partnering with clients to ensure that what you create moves their eCommerce business forward.

 **Qualifications** **What you need**

* **Experience:** You have 10+ years' experience being a Designer/Art Director in a digital agency environment, with 5+ years' experience overseeing creative & design teams.
* **A focused portfolio:** Your book showcases compelling and recent work where you’ve led teams to merchandise .com experiences for big brands, from design centric big box retailers to Fashion and Apparel and other premium consumer goods.
* **Vision:** Demonstrate the thought leadership in e-commerce and Brand experience design that builds trust with clients and converts shoppers.
* **Breadth:** You will not be an expert in all, but you must possess a rounded knowledge of all the disciplines involved in brand experience creation: design, copy, interactive development, copywriting and content strategy.
* **Empathy:** You lead with empathy and understanding. You embrace clear, kind collaboration with everyone

  

**Additional Information**  

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:

* Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
* Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
* Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
* Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
* Tuition Assistance
* Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
* Matching Gifts programs
* Flexible working arrangements
* ‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
* Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances

 *The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.*


Razorfish is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.


If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $153,000 - $240,500 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/21/2024.

We’re looking for a Bookkeeping Clerk to join our PharmScript team within our Accounting & Finance department.

As a Bookkeeping Clerk, the ideal candidates responsible for cash accounting including depositing daily cash collections, and posting cash receipts, maintaining cash collection details in excel files for cash application and assisting Bookkeepers with various clerical functions. The ideal candidate is a people person who enjoys working with others and is attentive to details. For you, no task feels too small and no challenge impossible. title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

EBG is an e-commerce solutions provider specializing in travel and entertainment, and also offering retail products and services, voluntary benefits and insurance.


EBG powers a robust portfolio of technology solutions and operates a network of employer and membership-based platforms reaching a captive audience, providing leading brands with incremental distribution opportunities. EBG's expanded network reaches over 100 million users from participating companies and closed loop affinity and membership groups.


EBG owns and operates one of the largest and most comprehensive employee savings programs in the country — serving over 40,000 corporate clients through its proprietary platforms TicketsatWork, Plum Benefits, Working Advantage and Beneplace.


EBG is a b2b2c company headquartered in Miami (Aventura), with offices in New York, Orlando, Austin and Las Vegas. We offer a hybrid work environment with a balance of collaboration and flexibility.

 **Job Description**  

EBG is looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to develop and manage marketing programs across channels and platforms, support business objectives, and advance brand building. The role will work closely with the VP of Consumer Marketing in leading, developing, implementing and executing strategic marketing plans for an entire organization in order to attract potential customers and retain existing ones.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Lead, develop and implement a fully integrated marketing strategy and lead the end-to-end development across marketing functions (including creative, messaging, merchandising, email, paid media, measurement, and reporting) to support specific partners and marketing objectives that is aligned with Company’s goals.
* Serve as the marketing relationship manager for EBG’s top Travel & Entertainment partners and products, including Broadway, Live Nation, Cirque Du Soleil, Concerts and Sporting Events to name a few
* Develop the strategic marketing plans for the T&E partners, along with updates and reporting on new developments with these partners
* Measure and report performance of marketing campaigns and sales to gain insight and assess against goals.
* Use KPIs from site and email along with sales data to plan out marketing initiatives for strategic partners and keep abreast of performance metrics to make on-demand decisions.
* Partner with the VP of Consumer Marketing with all aspects related to their responsibilities on integrated marketing, merchandising, CRM, paid media, reporting, and insights.
* Ability to lead and manage a team of Marketing Coordinators to assist in daily tasks
* Provide and present feedback and insight on the performance of marketing campaigns to external partners, tracking all elements of performance and working across teams to optimize.
* Work closely with partner managers to build out quarterly marketing plans for specific partnerships.
* Conducts research and analysis, translating campaign performance into reports and communication to senior management and key stakeholders. Some of these documents are marketing briefs, competitive analyses, and campaign recap decks.
* Partner with creative and content teams to create engaging and compelling creative materials to be used across different marketing channels.
* Partner and collaborate with email team to strategize, build and implement emails based on partner needs and segmentation strategies.
* Build strategic relationships with partners, key industry players, agencies and vendors.
* Coordinates approvals through marketing and external partners.
* Responsible for understanding external partner brands, such as brand logo, brand guidelines, experiences, and activations.


#LI-Hybrid

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business or similar discipline
* 5+ years of experience in digital marketing
* Experience in Entertainment, Travel or Hospitality Industry. Preferred industry experience in Live Entertainment such as theme parks, Broadway, shows or concerts.
* Digital Marketing in an agency or large-scale e-commerce company a plus
* Knowledge and experience in the following software/tools:
* Adobe Creative Cloud
* Google Analytics
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to think creatively and innovatively
* Must have attention to detail and possess critical thinking and quantitative skills
* Experience building complex digital marketing programs, presenting, and reporting on the results
* Familiarity with the latest trends, technologies and methodologies in graphic design, web and digital design, production, etc.
* Strong project management skills
* Strong problem-solving ability, including metrics-driven thinking
* Ability to travel as necessary
* Experience with online marketing, including social media, and content marketing
* Ability to quickly adapt to change


Compensation: $65k - $95k per year


Salary will be determined by multiple factors including but not limited to relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and alignment with market data.

 **Additional Information**  

Entertainment Benefits Group offers outstanding employee benefits including:

* Medical, Dental & Vision
* 401k Match
* Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability (Company Paid)
* Company Paid Basic Life and AD&D
* Additional Voluntary Benefits
* Flexible Work Arrangements
* 3 Weeks of PTO + 5 Personal Days
* Paid Holiday Break from Christmas to New Year
* Paid Holidays
* Fitness Centers (location dependent)
* Annual Day of Giving
* Share in the FUN! EBG gives $1000 per year in Tickets-At-Work gift cards to full-time employees to experience and enjoy the savings marketplace!


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


The statements contained herein reflect general details as necessary to describe the principal functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, and the scope of responsibility, but should not be consider an all-inclusive listing of work requirements.

title: Aide
description:

Our Therapy Aides are valued members of our clinic team. They ensure the equipment and clinic remain safe and clean for our patients, provide support to our front office team such as answering phones, collecting copays, checking in patients, and communicating with the patients and their family members. This is a great opportunity for students who are pursuing exercise science, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy or anyone who loves being in healthcare and helping others.
Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

 Position Qualifications:

title: Safety Monitor - 4333
description:
BronxWorks helps individuals and families improve their economic and social well-being. From toddlers to seniors, we feed, shelter, teach, and support our neighbors to build a stronger community. In all aspects of our work, we strive for the highest ethical and performance standards and guided by the belief that people are to be treated with dignity and respect regardless of their present situation or past experiences. We have 60 locations throughout the borough providing a variety of programs that offer assistance in the areas of family, children and youth support, educational services, elder care, homelessness, mental health, and workforce development. We are an employer of choice for anyone interested in a meaningful career in the social services field. **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Ensure the security of the premises and perform access control
* Perform regular and frequent foot patrol of the entire facility
* Enforce facility, BronxWorks, and Department of Homeless Services policies
* Promptly advise appropriate supervisors of problems
* Maintain order and promote safety
* Act professionally and as a role model for clients especially during crisis or conflict.
* Respond appropriately and effectively to physical or verbal altercations between clients.
* Respond appropriately to medical emergencies.
* Respond appropriately to situations of child abuse and neglect.
* Act as the liaison with police and other emergency services.
* Act as designated Fire Safety Coordinator or Fire Guard as needed.
* Promptly advise Shift Supervisor informed of problems or concerns.
* Make formal notifications as required.
* Participate in all training and staff meetings.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.
* extra hours and or overtime, as needed based on operational needs.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

* New York State Security Guard Registration Card.
* 16 Hour On-The-Job Security Guard Training Certificate.
* First Aid / CPR Certificate – Preferred.
* New York Fire Department Certificate of Fitness as Fire Guard, Shelters – Preferred.
* Ability to write a clear and concise incident report.
* Engaging personality and detailed orientated skills are essential.
* Strong oral and written communication, time management and organizational skills are necessary.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and other standard business technology is required.

 **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Basic computer skills
* Ability to create a clear and concise incident report
* Ability to drag an 80-pound canvas bag 30 feet on a tile floor within 30 seconds.
* Ability to lift a 40-pound bucket and place it on a standard height table within 30 seconds.

title: Business Admin Order Management Coordinator
description:
Leading IT provider has an exciting opportunity for an Order Management Coordinator/Supply Chain and Logistics Support to play an integral role in the continued growth of a dynamic company.

Targeting resources in the New York City area, the successful candidate will interface with the accounting department, sales, and management, with duties including oversight of all incoming orders, billing operations, and detailed coordination of all orders processed within the company.

The key responsibilities include:

· Processing Purchase Orders from the sales department, placing equipment orders with wholesalers, and tracking until delivery to designated end user.

· Coordinate with our customers and vendors for accurate and timely deliveries.

· Coordinate RMA’s (Returns)

· Coordinate services and track their progress

· Support our customer support desk with sending order updated to our customers during processing, shipping, tracking updates and confirmation of delivery.

· Use the programs such as Microsoft Excel, Sage Accounting, and Quoteworks

· Understand when to escalate order issues and how to mitigate supply chain risks.

· Learn our customer base and their shipping requirements

· Hold weekly meetings with management on open orders, scheduled orders, and order issues

· Generating and prepare invoices, and billing for orders once shipped or delivered.

· Sales reporting, verification of discrepancies and resolving any billing or delivery issues.

**The Company**

NYC leading IT solutions provider. Our customized solutions and managed services packages help our clients in the government and business sector optimize their IT infrastructure to ensure a safe, secure and convenient IT experience.

Focused on guaranteeing full client satisfaction while encouraging collaborative business engagements with our partners, our products and services include top-notch cloud packages such as: disaster recovery, data storage, cybersecurity, hardware, software acquisition, and more.

**The Person**

The key skills and qualities of an AR Specialist and Order Management Coordinator:

· Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or Accounting, with experience in bookkeeping.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills (email and phone).

· Strong organization and time-management skills.

· Strong attention to detail and swift with calculating sums, percentages, and deltas.

· Strong skills in sophisticated reporting and excel.

· Desired skills include: knowledge in IT and experience with Sage Account, Microsoft Excel and QuoteWerks

* Monday to Friday

title: Belt Production Worker
description:
The Manufacturing Technician performs a range of manufacturing tasks in the production process. Produce parts, perform set-up and operation of production equipment. Inspect, clean, calibrate, adjust and maintain production equipment. Use tools such as calipers and gauges to inspect output and ensure the product adheres to specifications and meet quality standards. Follow process and training documentation as well as adhere to safety, environmental and health regulations. Maintain accurate documentation and records. May be responsible for packaging/labeling/marking of finished goods.
**Shift 2nd: Monday – Thursday, 3:30 pm – 2:00 am**
*Ideal Candidate: experienced in manufacturing, job shop, or machine operator.*
Willing to train the right candidate, apply if actively interested in working for a family-oriented company, prepared to show up to work, work hard and learn the manufacturing craft surrounding polyurethane timing belts and accessories!

Manufacturing of polyurethane timing belts:*Profile Welding – thermal and chemical application to adhere polyurethane profiles to polyurethane belts** Entry of profile location in machine controller
* Using hand tool to weld profiles in place
* Use of grinder tool to clean belts
* Use of marking machine to mark belts
* Use of caliper or belt gauge to inspect

*Backing Application – thermal and chemical application to adhere backing material to polyurethane belts** Application of curing solvent to back of belts
* Application of backing
* Set up and running of backing equipment
* Trim excess material from belt edges
* Use of caliper and belt gauge to inspect

*Stamping – set up and run a hydraulic press to punch belts to length** Pick material from inventory
* Locate and move die to press
* Measure to length open-ended material
* Set up and operate a hydraulic punch press
* Use of caliper and belt gauge to inspect

*Open-Ended Belt Stamping/Slitting – set up and run machines to feed material to cut to length and slit to width open-ended belting** Pick material from inventory
* Locate appropriate feed wheel
* Set up and feed material through counter and cut to specified length
* Set up and feed material through slitter to the specified width
* Use of caliper and belt gauge to inspect

*Belt Welding – thermal and chemical weld process to weld belt ends together to specified length** As jobs are assigned and scheduled, locate punched belts, set up and clamp belt to welder
* Using templates and process work instruction run welder
* Slit and clean belts to meet specified width
* Use of caliper and belt gauge to inspect

*BRECOflex Benefits** Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* 401(k) plan with Company match
* Flexible Spending Account(s), Health Savings Account(s), & Dependent Care Account
* Paid Holidays
* PTO (Personal, Vacation and Sick Days)
* Disability Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Life Insurance


BRECO*flex* CO., L.L.C. is a family-oriented company that's been established in Monmouth County for over 30 years!

title: Sales Specialists, Perioperative - Augusta/Atlanta GA
description:
**Perioperative Sales Specialist - Augusta/Atlanta GA**

  

Mindray, founded in 1991, is a leading global developer, manufacturer, and supplier of medical devices whose mission is to deliver high-quality, richly featured medical products making healthcare more accessible and affordable around the world.

  

With North American headquarters located in Mahwah, NJ, and 42 international subsidiaries with branch offices in 32 countries, Mindray has approximately 14,000 employees worldwide. Eight global R&D centers and an industry-leading investment of 10% of annual revenue into research and development further demonstrate Mindray’s commitment to innovation and advancing technology in a global market.

  

To drive continued success in this exciting Medical Device field, we are seeking a **Sales Specialist, Perioperative** to join our winning team.

  

The Perioperative Sales Specialist is responsible for all sales activities of the A-Series anesthesia machine and Benevision N-series patient monitor product lines within an assigned geography at Acute Care Hospitals (L&D, OR, Preop, PACU, and Endo departments) along with Ambulatory Surgery Centers. This will require a full commitment to collaborating with all parties within the *EST (Enterprise Sales Team)*, to increase brand awareness while meeting/exceeding the individual’s territory annual sales revenue and growth expectations, along with meeting specific customer segment objectives. The position requires a commitment to routine collaborative review and analysis of established metrics/KPIs on a regular basis with Regional and National leadership for proper focus and alignment. This is a hunting role with the primary objective of business development and market share growth through competitive conversions.

  

Essential Functions:

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to maintain and increase Mindray North America’s (NA) market share by executing a territory business plan with a primary focus on new business development for A-Series anesthesia machines and Benevision N-series products in all acute care hospitals and ambulatory surgery centers. This requires the development and maintenance of a robust pipeline of sales opportunities, as it relates to the assigned geography.

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to demonstrate Mindray NA’s products after assessing customer needs; implement an action plan to utilize equipment for evaluation purposes; secure business to meet revenue objectives.

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to facilitate installation/in-services of acquired business by planning post-sale activities and addressing any questions and concerns; maintain a competitive edge while effectively completing the sales cycle.

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to maintain positive customer relations by problem-solving customer concerns on a timely basis; continue on-going customer support while maintaining positive references.

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to Exceed annual and quarterly territory revenue goals within the assigned customer segments and establish a book of business that assists with facilitating a National Key Opinion Leader program.

  

* Work collaboratively within the EST model to facilitate meetings with all divisions (Patient Monitoring, Perioperative, Ultrasound) on a daily, weekly, and quarterly basis to develop a synergistic strategy for converting competitive business to Mindray.
* Serve as Field Trainer (optional function) - The position requires periodic assistance in field and classroom sessions with trainees, following the prescribed program developed by the sales training department. Follow-up includes providing a written report to the Regional Sales Manager, National Sales Director, and Manager of Sales Training to ensure the management of the development of trainees and the identification of deficiencies.

 ***Position Specifications:***

 ***1.******Knowledge/Educational Requirements***

* BS/BA degree strongly preferred
* Prior experience selling capital equipment or medical equipment required
* Successful sales history and demonstrated ability to build a pipeline required
* Cold Calling experience and strong presentation skills are required

 ***2.*** ***Skills and Abilities***

* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written
* Excellent interpersonal and selling skills (listening, probing, closing)
* Ability to comprehend technical product line
* Ability to understand and develop strategies against the competition
* High energy
* Presentation skills (PowerPoint experience)
* Effective relationship-building skills
* Organizational skills in territory development
* Ability to work within a team in a strategic process

 ***3.*** ***Physical Demands/Work Environment***

* Must be able to drive for extended periods of time
* Must be willing and able to travel by airplane
* Must be able to lift at least 30 pounds of equipment
* Must be able to function in a hospital environment, for extended periods
* Must be able to travel 50 to 75% weekly with 2-4 overnights expected per week.

  

Mindray North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, marital status, ethnicity, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status and will not be harassed or discriminated against.

  

Mindray North America offers an attractive compensation and benefits package plus an exciting professional environment.


We thank all interested applicants, however, only those who meet our requirements will be contacted.


To find out more about Mindray North America and to review other career opportunities, please visit our website at www.mindraynorthamerica.com/careers

* **Except limited by applicable law, upon hire, Mindray will require COVID-19 vaccine verification to comply with relevant mandates and customer credential validation to gain access to medical facilities across the country.**

title: Maintenance Technician 2
description:
Description:

Experience. Reputation. Excellence. Longevity. These are the hallmarks of **Russo Development LLC**. We are one of the most active, privately held developers of industrial, data center, residential, and mixed-use projects in northern New Jersey.


Over the past 50 years we have developed more than eight million square feet of premier commercial space, delivered approximately 5400 luxury apartment units, completed more than 60 industrial projects and have become one of the largest owners of data center space in the New York metropolitan area. Now in our second generation of leadership, our privately-owned firm continues to surpass the needs of our tenants and residents and partners as one of the most successful niche development companies in the marketplace. After years of growth and success Russo Property Management LLC was established in 2017 to provide the highest quality residential and commercial management services at all properties owned or under development.

**If you are looking to join company that offers an EXCELLENT salary and benefits package, opportunity for career growth and a true people first culture, then Russo Development / Property Management may be for you!**


Russo Property Management is currently seeking an experienced Maintenance Technician with a strong background in multi-family residential maintenance. The Maintenance Technician is responsible for common area and apartment repairs in the scope of plumbing, HVAC, electrical, carpentry, and appliances. The Maintenance Technician handles all the aspects of the property’s maintenance including the physical grounds, ensuring curb appeal through interior and exterior building inspections, grounds maintenance, and preventative maintenance.


The candidate chosen for the position will be placed at our luxurious property located in Hackensack, NJ.

**Position Responsibilities:**

* Efficiently complete all daily work orders within 24 hours. Communicate any delays in completing a work order with the supervisor and management office.
* Troubleshoot repair any maintenance issues involving electrical, plumbing, A/C, HVAC, appliances and carpentry.
* Work with leasing staff team to ensure all make-ready repairs and services are completed and on schedule.
* Respond to after-hours on-call emergencies.
* Maintain accurate records for preventative maintenance, building mechanicals, service requests and apartment make- ready status.
* Stay current on all applicable building codes and safety standards.
* Assist with trash removal. Maintain trash rooms and dumpster areas.
* Assist in the proper clearing of snow during a snow event.
* Coordinate proper workshop inventory with maintenance supervisor.


Requirements:
* High School or GED education
* 1-3 years of direct experience working as a Maintenance Technician or related field.
* Must have reliable transportation and be able to respond to on-call emergencies at the property.
* Basic knowledge of plumbing, electrical, HVAC, carpentry, appliance maintenance, and snow removal.
* Exhibit exceptional customer service and attention to detail.
* Professional, courteous and friendly demeanor. Customer first attitude
* Proactive self-starter and a team-player.
* Must be available for weekend inspections, and weekday evening resident meetings, as necessary.
* Ability to professionally communicate with residents and staff.

 **EOE/M/F/D/V**

**\\*\\*NO RECRUITER SOLICITATION\\*\\***

title: Therapy Awareness Manager, New York City - Abiomed
description:
Abiomed, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Therapy Awareness Manager, to be located in the New York City, NY region in the United States.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



I Am Abiomed | I Am Heart Recovery | Patients First!



The Therapy Awareness Manager will be responsible for the development, planning and implementation of educational and marketing activities within their customer groups and regional scope. They will work with the referring physician community to raise awareness of treatment options with Impella. In addition, will be responsible for development and execution of market development programs that assist hospitals with identification of care pathways and standardization of care. The Therapy Awareness Manager will be responsible for the development of relationships within the cardiovascular space to include general cardiology, heart failure, Cardiac APPs, and CV surgery, plus the PCP environment. This individual will work in partnership with our Healthcare Solutions team to strengthen networks that create access to care for appropriate patient populations.



Job Responsibilities:


* Execution of high-impact Therapy Awareness events strategically planned in a cost-effective manner to increase access to advanced treatment options for patients
* Effective development of regional referrals for patients with CAD and/or Heart Failure for advanced therapy evaluation to include Impella protected procedures
* Provide clinical expertise and educate physicians, nurses, educators, and other health care providers on the indications and selection of patients that are candidates for Impella
* Creation of patient care pathways that identify high-risk patients and flag the need for Ischemic Evaluation
* Education to appropriate patient support groups/networks
* Assist hospitals on the development of marketing materials, CME symposiums, educational conferences, and other opportunities as identified with supervisor and field teams
* Effective and timely management of territory therapy development issues and process-related items including monthly reports, franchise action plans, Concur expense reporting, and Sales Force responsibilities
* Effective communication and collaboration on plan of action for territories with franchise field team members, marketing, training and education and management teams
* Exercises judgment in planning and organizing work; monitors performance and reports status
* Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* BA/BS degree required
* Minimum of 5 years or more successful outreach or market/business development experience within medical device and/or cardiac pharmaceutical field or >3-5 years of experience in hospital specialized program or care pathway setting
* Must have experience and contacts in the cardiovascular space with strong clinical acumen
* Demonstrated desire to attain the position
* Must be able to travel overnight extensively (60%)
* Ability to use PC's and associated software and excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated organization abilities


The anticipated base pay range for this position is $115,000. The Company maintains a highly competitive sales incentive compensation program. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for participation in this program in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan.



This position is eligible for a car allowance through the Company’s Fleet program.



Benefit Information:


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
* Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year


For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits (https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits)
